results.title: Cooking in liquids
results.creator_credit: Film Workshop, Gas Council and Dennis Shand
results.brief_description: Of interest to anyone who likes to cook, particularly beginners. This film shows the right temperature for boiling; a time-saving stew needing no preliminary frying; spaghetti hints; a marinade for tenderising; finally, an invitation to be experimental in the kitchen.

results.title: Cookie goes to hospital
results.creator_credit: Kit Hood, Linda Schuyler and Playing With Time
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kids of Degrassi Street”.
The kids of DeGrassi Street find themselves involved in another adventure when Cookie suddenly takes ill during a club meeting and is sent to hospital to have her appendix removed. Cookie is apprehensive of her first visit to hospital and asks her friends to get her doll from the club house. Provides an insight into hospital routines and operational procedures.

results.title: Conversion to automatic
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “How to Drive”.
Demonstrates how the automatic transmission operates and discusses the routine procedures the driver should follow for the safe driving of an automatic vehicle.

results.title: Conversation in the garden
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television and Richard Mudford
results.brief_description: A couple are seen in a suburban garden; outwardly they appear polite, inwardly their thoughts vividly snake through the undergrowth. Cast includes Heather Bolton and Stephen Clements.

results.title: Convention of Yanmar Overseas Agents, 1964
results.brief_description:
Convention held in Japan for overseas agents of the company Yanmar, founded by Magokichi Yamaoka. Shows the delegates involved in various activities including a visit to the factory, a bus trip to a memorial for the founder, group conference and discussion, social evening event, presentation of awards, a golf day, and the final gathering before departure.
Silent film - no credits available.

results.title: Controversy over the moon
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Charles L. Finance
results.brief_description: Presents the controversy concerning the geological make-up of the moon - specifically the origin of large lunar craters. Two eminent scientists interpret the same available data and discuss reasons for their divergent views. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Controversy over industrial pollution: a case study
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance, Luther Gerlach and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Environment in Crisis”.
Anaconda Aluminium Company opened a plant at Columbia Falls, Montana. In 1968, after a plant explosion, poisonous fluoride emissions began to damage trees for miles around. All sides of the resulting controversy are presented objectively in this film,which should spark discussion of the environmental crisis in general and of the scientific, social and economic issues involved in finding solutions to pollution problems

results.title: Controlling stocks
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Management Techniques”.
One of a series of films about some of the problems of forecasting, and of trying to achieve control through forecasts, particularly in the case of small and medium-sized firms. Carrying excessive stocks can be expensive, whilst insufficient stocks may cause loss of customer confidence. Shows how to strike a reasonable balance of stock holdings.
